Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text; the lower portion of the document is still unrolled and has a clay seal attached. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "[The four fragments are wrongly mounted. If they are styled from top downwards a b c d, the correct order would be d (reversed) a c b. with the seal at the top]. recto. 16 ll. verso. pasted down. Contents. acknowledgement of a loan of money on security of a house given by the Nubian Chello son of Heunesis to the lender Petearpres son of Pachois (cf. no 10392) - in double form. scribe Peteamenophis son of Petemestous. Date. year 5 Athyr of King Harmachis".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Bibliography: Pestman, P. W. Eine demotische Doppelurkunde, in: Boswinkel, E. / van Groningen, B. / Pestman, P. (ed.): Antidoron Martino David oblatum. Miscellanea Papyrologica (Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava 17), 1968, p. 100-111.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (8538) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/8538)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: rolled, fractured, loss Black ink Clay seal Backed: brown paper Transferred to horizontal storage 31 JAN 95 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: poor
